result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
with 13CF200
Hold bond money until sentencing

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas B. Baker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Scheduling Conference held on 10/16/14
Bail Hearing/Return on Warrant/Initial Appearance held on 9/23/14
Defendant Douglas B. Baker in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Douglas B. Baker in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. forward bond to DOC

Defendant Douglas B. Baker in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Douglas B. Baker in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. this case dismissed and read-in with 13cf200  apply bond to 13cf200

Defendant Douglas B. Baker in court in custody, with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DE acknowleges receipt of Information, pleads Not Guilty.  Court enters plea of Not Guilty.  Bail continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
DEF appears late with atty Schlough, cancel warrant, ADA John Yackel appears for the state, DEF has not been reported to STOP, Preliminary hearing is waived on this case,
Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Start Forfeiture Proceedings  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Douglas B. Baker in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Waives time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
